traitDescriptions.name: openness
traitDescriptions.descriptions:
Openness to experience.
Higher: Intellectually curious, emotionally-aware, sensitive to beauty and willing to try new things.
Lower: Preferring the plain, straightforward, and obvious over the complex, ambiguous, and subtle.

traitDescriptions.name: extraversion
traitDescriptions.descriptions:
Higher: More energetic and pronounced engagement with the external world. Likes high group visibility, talking, and asserting themselves.
Lower: Needs less stimulation and are more independent of their social world. It does not mean they are shy, un-friendly, or antisocial.

traitDescriptions.name: agreeableness
traitDescriptions.descriptions:
Higher: Value getting along with others. They have a more optimistic view of human nature.
Lower: Value self interests over others. They are more skeptical of others' motives.

traitDescriptions.name: conscientiousness
traitDescriptions.descriptions:
Higher: More self-disciplined, dutiful, or aiming for achievement against measures or outside expectations.
Lower: More likely to prefer the spontaneous over the planned.

traitDescriptions.name: curiousity
traitDescriptions.descriptions: A need to pursue experiences that foster learning, exploration, and growth.

traitDescriptions.name: ideal
traitDescriptions.descriptions: A desire to satisfy one's idea of perfection in a lifestyle or experience, oftentimes seen as pursuing a sense of community.

traitDescriptions.name: challenge
traitDescriptions.descriptions: A desire to achieve, succeed, compete, or pursue experiences that test one's abilities.

traitDescriptions.name: practicality
traitDescriptions.descriptions: A desire for getting the job done, skill, and efficiency.

traitDescriptions.name: stimulation
traitDescriptions.descriptions: Excitement, novelty, and challenge in life.

traitDescriptions.name: helping others
traitDescriptions.descriptions: Preserving and enhancing the welfare of those with whom one is in frequent personal contact.

traitDescriptions.name: tradition
traitDescriptions.descriptions: Respect, commitment, and acceptance of the customs and ideas that one's culture and/or religion provides.

traitDescriptions.name: achievement
traitDescriptions.descriptions: Personal success through demonstrating competence according to social standards.
